venue.name: Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD)

item.description:
February Lean Workshop

6:30pm -  Early Bird Presentation: Customer Development 101

For those new to the concepts of Customer Development and The Lean Startup, we'll start the evening with a talk about the basics of customer development and lean startups at 6:30pm. Come to listen to the presentation, or hang out and network over pizza!

 

7:00pm - Transitioning InfoChimps to Lean

Nick Ducoff, Co-Founder and Board Advisor at Infochimps

Transitioning to Lean once you already have a product in the market (with some success) is inherently hard because you have to revisit the past and question that success against your original goals. Then make the hard “pivot versus persevere” decision.

Nick co-founded Infochimps and led the company as CEO from 2010-2011, raising ~$3 million and growing the team and business. Previously, Nick was a VC lawyer for 4 years, working with startups and VC funds in company formation, debt and equity financings, M&A and IPOs. Nick continuously works with startups, including LegalReach, where he is an advisor, and Outbox, as an investor.

Nick got the startup bug in 2004 when he invested in Collegeboxes, which was acquired in 2008, and he started my first company in 2005, JDspace, which was a social and professional network for law students.
item.how_to_find_us: Check in at the front desk
item.name: Lean Startup Circle February Meetup
